meanings.definition: Not clearly or explicitly stated or expressed.
meanings.sent1: The instructions were so vague that I had no idea what to do.
meanings.sent2: She gave me the vaguest description of the movie plot.
meanings.sent3: His vague answers made everyone laugh at the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The fog was so thick, it created a vague outline of the trees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation was as vague as trying to catch a cloud.

meanings.definition: Lacking definite shape, form, or character.
meanings.sent1: The shadow in the dark alley looked vague and eerie.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted a vague figure in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out vague and unrecognizable after baking.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the event were as vague as a dream.
meanings.sent5: The mist covered the landscape in a vague blanket of white.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lack of precision or detail.
meanings.sent1: His vague explanation left us more confused than before.
meanings.sent2: The map was so vague that we got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The detective's vague clues led to a surprising twist in the case.
meanings.sent4: The stars were hidden behind a vague veil of clouds.
meanings.sent5: The recipe was so vague that the cake turned out completely different.
